DOC.brief_summary: Weight gain is both a significant risk factor for obstructive sleep apnea and a side-effect of long-term systemic steroids therapy. This study aimed to investigate the impact of long-term systemic steroid treatment on sleep apnea.
DOC.brief_title: Prospective Study of the Impact of Systemic Corticosteroid Use on Measures of Sleep Disordered Breathing
DOC.criteria: For inclusion, a scheduled therapy with a minimum daily dose of 10 mg prednisone (or equivalent) for at least 3 months was required Patients younger than 18 years and those with known sleep apnea or other forms of sleepdisordered breathing were excluded
